Major_Arcs.title: Nan's Lament and Ghost Town's Fate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan and her disillusionment in a saloon setting, followed by a shift to the ghost town of Merrick Gulch and the impending threat of its demolition for a new airport.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Lament
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her dissatisfaction with her current life in a saloon, contrasting it with her youthful dreams of glamour and adventure to a skeptical listener.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Arrival and Demolition Plans
sub_scenes.description: Nan abruptly leaves the saloon, and the narrative shifts to a group of men arriving at Merrick Gulch, revealing plans to build an airport and demolish the ghost town, causing distress to Nan who overhears.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Ghost Town and Development Plans

Major_Arcs.title: Love, Rejection, and Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's evolving relationship against the backdrop of the ghost town's demolition, encompassing misunderstandings, familial disapproval, and eventual reconciliation amidst the impending destruction.

sub_scenes.title: Cal and Nan's Misunderstanding
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss romantic feelings and misjudgments, revealing their complex emotions in the face of Nan's romantic ideals.

sub_scenes.title: Ghost Town Demolition and Nan's Resistance
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to the ghost town demolition site where Nan confronts the workers, expressing her strong opposition and distress.

sub_scenes.title: Father's Disapproval and Nan's Humiliation
sub_scenes.description: Nan interrupts her father's business meeting, leading to a discussion about horses and construction. Her father dismisses her ideas, scolds her, and threatens physical punishment, causing Nan deep humiliation.

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Comfort and Nan's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Nan's mother comforts her and advises patience with Cal. Nan resolves to seek clarity from Cal about their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Seek Clarity from Cal

sub_scenes.title: Father's Business and Cal's Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan is instructed by her father regarding horses for the airport, leading to a confrontation with Cal about their relationship and the horses, ending with Cal's defiant departure.

sub_scenes.title: Loneliness, Reflection, and Reconciliation
sub_scenes.description: Nan experiences loneliness after Cal's departure, leading to his return and confession of feelings weeks later in a snowy setting.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Loneliness and Reflection on Cal's Absence

Major_Arcs.title: Weather Crisis and Community Help
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details a severe snowstorm threatening the community, focusing on the characters' reactions, the arrival of aid via airplane, and the communal hope it brings amidst despair.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Concerns and Impending Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss dire weather conditions. Mr. Wills reports extreme snowfall, highlighting the unprecedented nature of the storm and its threat to cattlemen.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Mr. Wills' and Weather Report
Historical Context of Severe Snow and Impending Starvation

sub_scenes.title: Cal's Leadership and Aerial Relief
sub_scenes.description: Cal resolves to act amidst the crisis. Despair turns to hope as a plane arrives dropping fodder, symbolizing community aid and sparking a sense of romance.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Resolve to Save the Cattle
Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Discovery
Fodder from the Plane and Seeds of Romance

Major_Arcs.title: Benson's Showdown and Jeff's Hero Worship
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his violent act in town, exploring the townspeople's reactions and focusing on young Jeff's admiration for Benson, causing concern for his sister Sally and Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Town Showdown and Reactions
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson is depicted in a street fight, and townspeople react with mixed opinions, while Jeff defends Benson, prompting Sally and Clyde to discuss Jeff's hero worship.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Showdown and Town Reactions

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Clyde's Concerns about Jeff
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Clyde discuss Jeff's fascination with violent figures and guns, expressing worry about his behavior and past trauma.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Reflection on Jeff's Youth and Clyde's Commentary
Jeff's Defensive Outburst and Clyde Insult
Sally and Clyde's Worries About Jeff's Behavior

sub_scenes.title: Flashback to Jeff's Past and Benson's Influence
sub_scenes.description: Sally recounts a flashback of Jeff's past anxieties and the introduction of Mr. Benson into their lives, highlighting a potentially negative influence.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Flashback of Jeff's Troubling Past
Introduction to Mr. Benson and Ominous Advice

Major_Arcs.title: Newspaper Conflict and Benson's Downfall
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the conflict arising from Clyde's critical newspaper article about Chane Benson, leading to threats, confrontations, and ultimately Benson's departure from town after a fair fight.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Repercussions and Sally's Fear
sub_scenes.description: An angry woman confronts Clyde about his article, and Sally expresses her fear for Clyde's safety due to Benson's potential violent reaction.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Calculated Response and Town Gossip
sub_scenes.description: Benson reacts calmly to the article, deciding to stay in town. Town gossip spreads about the article and its implications.

sub_scenes.title: Dinner Invitation and Rising Tensions
sub_scenes.description: Er suggests inviting Benson to dinner as a strategy. Dinner takes place, but tensions rise with Jeff's accusations and Chane's threatening behavior towards Sally.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Rejection and Jeff's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Chane after his assault. Sally explains to Jeff about Chane. Chane confronts Jeff aggressively. Sally warns Jeff about Chane's intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Threat and Assertion of Dominance
Sally's Rage, Chane's Departure, and Warning about Clyde
Jeff's Determined Pursuit to Save Clyde
Confrontation and Er's Plea for Restraint

sub_scenes.title: Fair Fight and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Chane engage in a fair fight. Jeff explains the situation to Sis. Sally and Clyde decide on a headline change. The newspaper team reflects on the power of words and family legacy.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Explanation to Sis about Clyde
Sally and Clyde's Conversation about Headline Change
Office Discussion: Newspaper Edition and Lessons Learned

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Rivalry and Betsy's Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy's ranch and the arrival of Steve Daley, exploring ranch conflicts, territorial disputes, and the development of a complex romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve.

sub_scenes.title: Whip Fight and New Boss Introduction
sub_scenes.description: A whip fight initiates ranch tension, followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss.

sub_scenes.title: Trouble and Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: Discussion arises about trouble starting with Steve's arrival, leading to Betsy's skepticism about Hank's judgment.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Betsy's Job and Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Range War Warning and Caution
sub_scenes.description: Hank warns Betsy of a potential range war, and they agree on a cautious approach.

sub_scenes.title: Polite Refusal and Father's Order
sub_scenes.description: Steve offers Betsy a ride, which she politely declines, followed by Hank issuing an order.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of a Ride and Polite Refusal

sub_scenes.title: Dress Material and Father's Disregard
sub_scenes.description: Betsy expresses frustration over Hank's disregard for her wishes regarding dress material.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Bridges and Fight
sub_scenes.description: Betsy confronts Fred Bridges, leading to escalating threats and a physical fight.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Fight

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Realization and Steve's Role
sub_scenes.description: Betsy realizes Steve is a hired gunslinger. Hank expresses gratitude towards Steve. Betsy suggests personal thanks.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Realization and Decision about Steve Daley
Betsy's Change of Heart Regarding Firing Steve
Hank's Gratitude and Betsy's Suggestion for Personal Thanks

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Condition and Steve's Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets a condition for Steve's job, focusing on his guns. This leads to declarations of love and a dilemma about Steve's gunfighter identity.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Conflicted Feelings about Steve's Gunslinger Identity
Declaration of Love and the Dilemma of Steve's Identity
Steve's Stance and Betsy's Plea for Love
Betsy's Unconditional Love and Steve's Wavering Resolve

sub_scenes.title: Impending Trouble and Betsy's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Trouble looms, and Betsy threatens someone for trespassing. She confronts Steve about valley takeover plans.

sub_scenes.title: Reflection on Conflict and Betsy's Authority
sub_scenes.description: Narrative reflects on past conflicts, Betsy asserts her authority and right to carry guns. Steve reflects on his past and expresses concern about recent events.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Past Conflict and Gunfighter Identity

sub_scenes.title: Hank's Resolve and Betsy's Justification
sub_scenes.description: Betsy pleads with Hank not to go, but Hank resolves to get his guns. Betsy justifies violence, and Steve reluctantly agrees to act.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Justification and Steve's Reluctant Agreement

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Internal Conflict and Journey to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy reflects on her actions. The journey to Devil's Pass begins after Hank leaves, gunfire ceases as they approach.

narrative_arcs.title: The Silent Journey and Cessation of Gunfire

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Captive
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at Devil's Pass leads to confrontation and an argument about a captive, who is then harmed.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Accusation

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Romantic Future
sub_scenes.description: Betsy recovers, Steve expresses gratitude, and they share affection, hinting at a hopeful romantic future despite the violence.

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie's Love Triangle and Business Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Carrie's complex relationships with Dave and Fred, intertwined with business dealings and range conflicts, leading to a proposal and ultimate betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Argument about Dave and Range Trouble
sub_scenes.description: An argument about Dave occurs, followed by the arrival of Curley and news of range trouble, setting up new conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Line Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Ranchers investigate a new fence, leading to a tense confrontation with Fred Gordon and his men at the fence line.

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance and Reflection
sub_scenes.description: After the standoff, characters reassure each other and reflect on budding romance amidst the tension.

narrative_arcs.title: Apologies and Reassurance After the Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Ominous Reappearance and Carrie's Assertiveness
sub_scenes.description: Fred Gordon reappears ominously, questioning Carrie and Dave, to which Carrie responds assertively, rejecting his insinuations.

sub_scenes.title: Confession and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Dave supports Carrie, and Carrie confesses past feelings for Fred and current affection for Dave, leading to a romantic proposal from Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Support and Carrie's Confession of Love
Reflections on Past Misunderstandings and a Romantic Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Strategic Proposition and Selfish Motives
sub_scenes.description: Fred proposes a business deal to Carrie, revealing selfish motives and prioritizing the Carlton contract over their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Fred's Strategic Proposition and Carrie's Initial Reaction
The Unveiling of Fred's Selfish Motives and Carrie's Betrayal

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Rejection and Retaliation Plan
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts and rejects Fred, then resolves to retaliate by seeing Mr. Carlton with Pete's support.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Angry Confrontation and Rejection of Fred
The Confrontation with Fred and Dave's Unexpected Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Confrontation with Carlton and Triumph
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton about deceitful practices, ultimately emerging victorious from their meeting, leaving Fred defeated.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Declaration and Fred's Ousting
sub_scenes.description: Carrie definitively rejects Fred and asserts her control over the contract.

sub_scenes.title: Chance Encounter and Confession in Town
sub_scenes.description: Weeks later, Carrie and Dave meet in town, leading to Carrie confessing her love for Fred, causing Dave to abruptly leave.

sub_scenes.title: Ride Back and Dave's Advice
sub_scenes.description: During their ride back, Dave gives Carrie advice regarding Fred and her feelings, urging her to reconcile.

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Ailment and Dave's Persuasion
sub_scenes.description: Carrie falls ill, prompting visits and revelations about Fred's true nature and leading to Dave persuading Carrie to consider him.

narrative_arcs.title: Carlton's Account of Fred's Visit and Carrie's Rejection
Dave's Interrogation and Carrie's Love Confession
Dave's Pragmatic Advice and Carrie's Emotional Turmoil
Dave's Persuasion and Carrie's Plea for Affection

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie share a kiss and embrace, marking a potential romantic turn.

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Final Encounter and Wedding
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Dirk and Rance's dramatic encounter, their escape, separation, and eventual resolution leading to Rance and Chris's wedding, punctuated by Dirk's unexpected, yet ultimately peaceful, reappearance.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Arrival and Injury
sub_scenes.description: Dirk arrives injured and cryptically announces he is 'done,' revealing a bullet wound upon examination.

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Ranch Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Concerned parties investigate Dirk's situation, leading to a confrontation at a ranch where Rance Cready challenges a woman claiming ownership.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Questioning at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Standoff and Moral Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: A confrontation ensues with Rance Cready and a woman over Dirk's fate, debating law versus justice and Dirk's injury.

sub_scenes.title: Temporary Truce and Woman's Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Rance softens his stance, agreeing to a temporary truce while the woman reflects on her growing feelings for Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Shift in Stance and Temporary Truce

sub_scenes.title: Evolving Relationship and Confession
sub_scenes.description: Rance and the woman's relationship evolves, leading to Chris confessing her love for Rance.

narrative_arcs.title: Evolving Relationship - Night Encounter and Recognition

sub_scenes.title: Separation and Chris's Dilemma
sub_scenes.description: Rance suggests they leave Dirk, creating a dilemma for Chris, who ultimately chooses loyalty to her brother.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Gunfight
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Chris realize they are being pursued, leading to a confrontation with the Marshal and a gunfight where Chris is injured.

narrative_arcs.title: Retrospective on Evasion Attempts and the Marshal's Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath and Moral Choice
sub_scenes.description: The immediate aftermath of the gunfight involves Chris's injury, Dirk's moral dilemma about the Marshal, and Rance's accusation.

sub_scenes.title: Escape and Farewell
sub_scenes.description: Dirk decides to leave the Marshal, they prepare to escape, leading to a farewell and Chris's accusation, followed by her confession of love.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Leave the Marshal and Reflection

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Reflection and Dirk's Confusion
sub_scenes.description: Rance reflects on her love for Dirk, and Dirk is shown in a confused state, needing help.

sub_scenes.title: Resolution in Mexico
sub_scenes.description: Dirk and Rance successfully reach Mexico, resolving their escape storyline.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Unconsciousness and Recovery
sub_scenes.description: Rance is found unconscious, then recovers at the ranch under Chris's and her father's care.

sub_scenes.title: Mutual Concern and Father's Hint
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance express mutual concern, and Chris's father hints at unresolved 'business' before leaving them alone.

sub_scenes.title: Business Discussion and Rejection of Punishment
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Rance discuss the 'business,' leading to Chris rejecting punishment and expressing gratitude.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Resolution and Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses her love, leading to Rance reciprocating and proposing marriage, culminating in a kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and Proposal Tease

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day Reflections and Dirk's Shadow
sub_scenes.description: The bride reflects on her relationship and fears about Dirk's return on her wedding day.

narrative_arcs.title: Walking Down the Aisle and Dirk's Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Interruption and Marshal's Gift
sub_scenes.description: Dirk dramatically interrupts the wedding, leading to a confrontation, de-escalation by the father, and the Marshal presenting a wedding gift - Dirk's guns - while explaining past events and Dirk's fate.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal's Wedding Gift and Dirk's Fate
Final Remarks on Dirk and Rance's Taste
